idea-plugin.name: BEM HTML Inspector
idea-plugin.description:
Inspection for checking HTML markup for compliance with the BEM methodology.

Features:

  • Validates BEM class naming conventions
  • Checks element nesting and parent-child relationships
  • Validates modifier usage
  • Supports HTML and Blade templates
  • Real-time validation as you type

Key Benefits:

  • Maintain consistent BEM naming across your project
  • Prevent common BEM mistakes
  • Improve code quality and maintainability
  • Speed up development with instant feedback

Supported Rules:

  • Element must be inside its block
  • Modifier must be used with base class
  • No element or modifier without block
  • No double separators
  • Block naming conventions
  • Element nesting depth
  • Modifier without element class

Examples:

Correct usage:

<div class="block">
    <div class="block__element"></div>
    <div class="block__element block__element--modifier"></div>
</div>

Incorrect usage:

<div class="block__element"></div>
<div class="block__element--modifier"></div>
<div class="block__element1__element2"></div>

For more information and examples, visit our GitHub repository.
